conflictDescription: Some NFRs contradict because caregiver control over technology use (including data sharing) conflicts with the older adult's desire to block all data sharing and suppress notifications, making it impossible to satisfy both fully under the same conditions. However, other NFRs about supporting autonomy or minimizing technology overwhelm may be compatible or complementary.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow caregivers to configure ALFRED's technology usage per client to respect individual privacy preferences
Block all sharing of personal and health data with external parties
Allow caregivers to configure ALFRED's technology usage per client to respect individual privacy preferences
Reject or suppress nearly all system notifications to the user
Prevent technology use that may cause client discomfort or mistrust
Reject or suppress nearly all system notifications to the user
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to control ALFRED's technology use to prioritize each client's privacy and autonomy, ensuring their independence without discomfort or mistrust.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block all data sharing and reject almost all notifications so I can keep my privacy and avoid feeling overwhelmed by technology.

conflictDescription: The caregiver's need to configure ALFRED's technology use to respect privacy may conflict with the older adult's strict desire to block notifications and prevent any data sharing, as the caregiver's control implies some level of data access and notification which the older adult wants to fully block.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow caregivers to configure ALFRED's technology usage per client to respect individual privacy preferences
Prevent sharing any personal data with family, caregivers, doctors, or third parties
Allow caregivers to configure ALFRED's technology usage per client to respect individual privacy preferences
Block almost all ALFRED notifications to the user
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to control ALFRED's technology use to prioritize each client's privacy and autonomy, ensuring their independence without discomfort or mistrust.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block almost all ALFRED notifications and prevent any data sharing with family, caregivers, doctors, or third parties to protect my privacy and feel secure.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to communicate health data with patients using a formal and clinical tone, implying access and sharing of health data, whereas User Story B demands blocking all sharing and access to health data by anyone including caregivers and doctors, which makes the communication based on health data impossible.
conflictingNfrPairs: Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Prevent any sharing of the user's health data
Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Ensure no access to health data by caregivers, doctors, or third parties
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to use a strictly formal and clinical communication style with patients to maintain clear professional boundaries and focus on health data.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block all sharing of my health data to maintain full privacy and prevent any access by family, caregivers, doctors, or third parties.

conflictDescription: There is a conflict between the caregiver's need to focus communication exclusively on health data and the older adult's desire to block sharing of all sensor data, including with caregivers, as these goals cannot be fully satisfied simultaneously under the same conditions.
conflictingNfrPairs: Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Prevent sharing of all sensor data with caregivers
Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Ensure complete privacy protection of sensor data
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to use a strictly formal and clinical communication style with patients to maintain clear professional boundaries and focus on health data.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block sharing of all my sensor data with anyone, including caregivers and third parties, to fully protect my privacy.

conflictDescription: The caregiver's need to communicate health data with the patient implies some level of data sharing and external communication, which conflicts with the older adult's requirement to block all data sharing outside the ALFRED system. However, the communication style and professional boundaries do not inherently conflict with data sharing restrictions.
conflictingNfrPairs: Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Prevent any data sharing outside the ALFRED system
Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Ensure no personal or health data leaves the user's device
Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Provide user control to block all external data transmission
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to use a strictly formal and clinical communication style with patients to maintain clear professional boundaries and focus on health data.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block all data sharing entirely to protect my privacy and feel secure using the system.

conflictDescription: The medical staff's requirement to focus communication exclusively on health data conflicts with the older adult's requirement to prohibit sharing of any personal or sensor data, making it impossible to share health data while fully protecting privacy. However, the communication style and privacy protection goals do not inherently contradict each other.
conflictingNfrPairs: Focus communication content exclusively on health data and related information
Prohibit sharing of any personal or sensor data collected by ALFRED devices
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to use a strictly formal and clinical communication style with patients to maintain clear professional boundaries and focus on health data.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to wear ALFRED devices only reluctantly and with no data sharing allowed to fully protect my privacy and feel safe.
